title.value: Unraveling the Interconnected Axes of Heterogeneity in Machine Learning for Democratic and Inclusive Advancements
title.justification: This is the exact title provided in the document.
title.quote:
Unraveling the Interconnected Axes of Heterogeneity in
Machine Learning for Democratic and Inclusive Advancements

extractions.description: The paper examines the interconnected axes of heterogeneity in machine learning systems, specifically focusing on values, culture and regulations, data composition, and resource and infrastructure capacity. It discusses how these axes influence each other and the overall trajectory of ML products, emphasizing the need for a holistic approach to ensure democratic and inclusive advancements. The paper critiques the current fragmented research approach and advocates for new socio-technical frameworks for sustainable ML development.

type.justification: The paper proposes a theoretical framework and critique of current practices in ML development for democratic and inclusive advancements, without conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: We examine the prevalent practices and methodologies that skew these axes in favor of a selected few, resulting in power concentration, homogenized control, and increased dependency.

name.justification: The focus on democratic, inclusive advancements, and socio-technical frameworks aligns with the domain of Responsible AI.
name.quote: This paper contributes to the understanding of these aspects and advocates for their comprehensive consideration in ML system design, and calls for new socio-technical frameworks enabling a truly inclusive and sustainable ML development landscape.

name.justification: Discussion on fairness, accountability, and the ethical implications of decision-making processes in ML systems.
name.quote: The growing utilization of machine learning (ML) in decision-making processes raises questions about its beneÔ¨Åts to society.

name.justification: The paper deeply discusses fairness issues in ML models and the need for fair representation.
name.quote: Fairness should be understood as a subjective perception shaped by past interactions and cultural values that vary across societies.
